text.sanskrit: मा चिदन्यद्वि शंसत सखायो मा रिषण्यत ।इंद्रमित्स्तोता वृषणं सचा सुते मुहुरुक्था च शंसत ॥

translations.text: Repeat, friends, no other praise, be not hurtful (to yourselves); praise togetherIndra, the showerer (ofbenefits) when theSomais effused; repeately utter praise (to him).

translations.text: You are more precious,Indra, than my father, or than my brother, who is not affectionate; you, giver ofdwellings, are equal to my mother, for you both render me distinguished on account of celebrity and riches.

translations.text: Indra, by the might of his strength, has spread out the heaven and earth; Indra has lighted up the sun;in Indra are all beings aggregated; the distilling drops of theSomaflow to Indra.

translations.text: He who has made his praise attain to you associates himself with a thousand gallant combatants; hewho offers oblations with reverence begets a valiant son, the scatterer (of enemies).

text.sanskrit: मा भेम मा श्रमिष्मोग्रस्य सख्ये तव ।महत्ते वृष्णो अभिचक्ष्यं कृतं पश्येम तुर्वशं यदुं ॥

translations.text: (Secure) in the friendship of you who are terrible, let us not fear, let us not be harassed; great andglorious, showerer (of benefits), are your deeds, as we may behold them in the case ofTurvaśa, ofYadu.

text.sanskrit: सव्यामनु स्फिग्यं वावसे वृषा न दानो अस्य रोषति ।मध्वा संपृक्ताः सारघेण धेनवस्तूयमेहि द्रवा पिब ॥

translations.text: The showerer (of benefits) with his left hip covers (the world), no tearer (of it) angers him; the delightful(Somajuices) are mixed with the sweet honey of the bee; come quickly hither, hasten, drink.

text.sanskrit: ऋश्यो न तृष्यन्नवपानमा गहि पिबा सोमं वशाँ अनु ।निमेघमानो मघवंदिवेदिव ओजिष्ठं दधिषे सहः ॥

translations.text: Who knows him drinking with (the priests) when theSomais effused? What food has he partaken of?He, the handsome-jawed, who, exhilarated by the (sacrificial) Soma, destroys cities by his might.

text.sanskrit: प्र ब्रह्माणि नभाकवदिंद्राग्निभ्यामिरज्यत ।या सप्तबुध्नमर्णवं जिह्मबारमपोर्णुत इंद्र ईशान ओजसा नभंतामन्यके समे ॥

translations.text: Inasmuch as these people honourIndraandAgniwith gifts and with praises, so may we, defying hosts,overcome (our foes) with our warriors; let us praise those seeking praise; may all our adversaries perish.

text.sanskrit: स क्षपः परि षस्वजे न्युस्रो मायया दधे स विश्वं परि दर्शतः ।तस्य वेनीरनु व्रतमुषस्तिस्रो अवर्धयन्नभंतामन्यके समे ॥

translations.text: He embraces the nights; of goodly aspect, and quick of movement, he encompasses the universe byhis acts; all who are desirous (of his favour) diligently offer him worship at the three diurnal rites; may all ouradversaries perish.

text.sanskrit: यः ककुभो निधारयः पृथिव्यामधि दर्शतः ।स माता पूर्व्यं पदं तद्वरुणस्य सप्त्यं स हि गोपा इवेर्यो नभंतामन्यके समे ॥

translations.text: Come let us praise the purifiedIndrawith a pureSāmanand with pure recited hymns; let the pure(Soma) mixed with milk gladden him waxing strong.

translations.text: Purified,Indra, give us wealth; purified give to your worshipper precious things; purified you smite yourenemies; purified you desire to give us food.

text.sanskrit: अतिविद्धा विथुरेणा चिदस्त्रा त्रिः सप्त सानु संहिता गिरीणां ।न तद्देवो न मर्त्यस्तुतुर्याद्यानि प्रवृद्धो वृषभश्चकार ॥

text.sanskrit: इंद्रस्य वज्र आयसो निमिश्ल इंद्रस्य बाह्वोर्भूयिष्ठमोजः ।शीर्षन्निंद्रस्य क्रतवो निरेक आसन्नेषंत श्रुत्या उपाके ॥

text.sanskrit: मन्ये त्वा यज्ञियं यज्ञियानां मन्ये त्वा च्यवनमच्युतानां ।मन्ये त्वा सत्वनामिंद्र केतुं मन्ये त्वा वृषभं चर्षणीनां ॥

translations.text: I think you the most worthy among those worthy of sacrifice; I think you the overthrower of theimperishable (mountains); I think you,Indra, the banner of warriors; I think you the showerer (of blessings) tomen.

translations.text: When,Indra, you grasp in your arms your pride humbling thunderbolt to smite Ahi, when the mountainclouds loudly roar and the cows loudly bellow, then thebrāhmaṇasoffer their worship to Indra.

text.sanskrit: मह उग्राय तवसे सुवृक्तिं प्रेरय शिवतमाय पश्वः ।गिर्वाहसे गिर इंद्राय पूर्वीर्धेहि तन्वे कुविदंग वेदत् ॥

translations.text: Indrais the slayer ofVṛtra, the cherisher of men; let us invoke him worthy of invocation, with anexcellent hymn; he isMaghavan, our protector, our encourager, he is the bestower of food that brings fame.
